description: Borrowed from Afrikaans mielie, from obsolete Dutch milie (“millet, maize”), from Old French mil (“millet”).

entries.meaning: (South Africa) An ear or kernel of maize; in plural as mass noun: maize, corn.
examples: The wants of a native living with his tribe and cultivating mealies or Kafir corn are confined to a kaross (skin cloak) or some pieces of cotton cloth.
